intro: Oxalis loxensis, commonly known as the red oxalis, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. The plant produces edible tubers that are sometimes used in traditional cuisine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. Oxalis loxensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
